rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;4d0da31c.1503">   <title>A History of Women in British Film and Television - website update </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;4d0da31c.1503</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>The website for the 'History of Women...' project has recently been refreshed, with new information about film and television women including our 'women of the month' Bessie Bond and an overview of our recent workshop on 'oral history and narrative interviewing'.<br><br>http://research.ncl.ac.uk/womensworkftvi/<br><br>More details to follow soon about the project conference in Leicester in May 2016 where the project's new digital resource will be unveiled. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T15:45:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Melanie Bell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;4d0da31c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;751cf5de.1503">   <title>Short Film (And) Criticism Symposium </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;751cf5de.1503</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Glasgow Short Film Festival and University of Glasgow School of Culture &amp; Creative Arts<br><br>in association with University of Edinburgh: MSc Film, Exhibition &amp; Curation and Scottish Media and Communications Association<br><br>present a one day symposium:<br><br>Short Film (and) Criticism<br><br>Saturday 14 March 2015<br><br>CCA Theatre<br><br>Glasgow<br><br>Each year, Glasgow Short Film Festival stages a one day inclusive cross-disciplinary event, intended to bring together academics, critics, curators, filmmakers and a wider general audience to explore a specific aspect of short film in more detail. The symposia typically follow a structure of two or three panel discussions, a workshop [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T11:47:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Archibald</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;751cf5de.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;68263d9f.1503">   <title>Experimental Film in the 70s: A Decade of Diversity. A BFI Reuben Library Talk with Patti Gaal-Holmes. 13th of April. 18.30. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;68263d9f.1503</link>   <description> Experimental Film in the 70s: A Decade of Diversity. An illustrated talk with Patti Gaal-Holmes, author of A History of 1970s Experimental Film: Britain's Decade of Diversity (Palgrave) providing a key background for our Cinema Born Again season. BFI Reuben Library. Monday 13th April. 18.30. Booking and details at https://whatson.bfi.org.uk/Online/experimentalfilminthe70s. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T10:43:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Peter Todd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;68263d9f.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;23a341b3.1503">   <title>New Directions in Film and Television Production Studies, 14-15 April 2015: Penultimate reminder </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;23a341b3.1503</link>   <description> ??Dear colleagues,<br><br>New Directions in Film and Television Production Studies is a two-day international conference hosted by UWE Bristol and Portsmouth University taking place at Watershed Bristol on 14 and 15 April 2015. Featuring keynote presentations from speakers including Professor John Thornton Caldwell (UCLA), Professor Philip Drake (Edge Hill University) and writer-producer Tony Klinger, the conference brings together an international community of scholars and industry professionals to take stock of developments in the field thus far and explore new directions for scholarship in the future. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T09:43:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Steve Presence</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;23a341b3.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;4250bae9.1503">   <title>CFP: HIstorical Fictions Research Network Conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;4250bae9.1503</link>   <description> Call for Papers for the First Interdisciplinary Historical Fictions Research Network Conference<br><br>Keynote Speaker: Professor Ansgar N\ufffd\ufffdnning of Universitat Giessen (Literature &amp; American Studies).<br>http://www.uni-giessen.de/cms/faculties/f05/engl/lit/staff/profs/ansgar_nuenning<br><br>At: Anglia Ruskin University. Cambridge<br>Date: 27th and 28th February 2016<br>Conference fee: \ufffd\ufffd180; concession \ufffd\ufffd140 (graduate students; or on proof of income below \ufffd\ufffd10k).<br>Accommodation: tbc<br><br>This is a key moment for the study of historical fictions: there is a rising critical recognition of the texts and the convergence of lines of theory in the philosophy of history, narratology, popular literature, historical narratives of national and cultural identity, and cross-disciplinary approaches to narrative constructions [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T04:16:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lubbren, Nina</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;4250bae9.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;625de4f0.1503">   <title>Re: film critics </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;625de4f0.1503</link>   <description> Melanie Bell is too modest to mention this herself, so I'll add that her article 'Film criticism as "women's work": the gendered economy of film criticism in Britain', was awarded the Routledge-IAMHIST Prize for Best Article by an Established Scholar published in the Historical Journal of Film, Radio and Television in 2011. ________________________________________ From: Announcement list for the British Association of Film, Television and Screen Studies [BAFTSS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] on behalf of Melanie Bell [Melanie.Bell@NEWCASTLE.AC.UK] Sent: Tuesday, March 10, 2015 6:08 PM To: BAFTSS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK Subject: film critics If anyone wants a historical perspective on women's contribution to film criticism in Britain you [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T20:04:01+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chapman, James R. (Prof.)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;625de4f0.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;31134385.1503">   <title>Fwd: Film Submissions Call Out - Nour Festival of Arts 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;31134385.1503</link>   <description> *Apologies for crossposting*<br><br>This may be of interest to some budding filmmakers of the middle<br>eastern/north African variety.<br><br>Alex<br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: &quot;Yasmin El Derby&quot; &lt;yasmin.elderby@gmail.com&gt;<br>Date: 10 Mar 2015 18:19<br>Subject: Film Submissions Call Out - Nour Festival of Arts 2015<br>To: &quot;Yasmin El Derby&quot; &lt;filmsforsubmission@gmail.com&gt;<br>Cc:<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>That time has come around again for me to begin the search for great films<br>to be screened at this year's Nour Festival of Arts 2015<br>www.nourfestival.co.uk [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T18:25:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alexander Hastie</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;31134385.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;8ae4d7f0.1503">   <title>film critics </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;8ae4d7f0.1503</link>   <description> If anyone wants a historical perspective on women's contribution to film criticism in Britain you may be interested in a couple of articles I wrote a few years ago about film critics such as Catherine de la Roche, Freda Bruce Lockhart and E. Arnot Robertson who made regular contributions to the popular and 'quality' press, frequently appeared on radio programmes such as Woman's Hour and The Critics, and contributed to the BFI's post-war education programme as lecturers. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T18:08:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Melanie Bell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;8ae4d7f0.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;9724576e.1503">   <title>Conference Registration Open: Exploring 30 Years of Studio Ghibli </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;9724576e.1503</link>   <description> With apologies for any cross-posting.<br><br>The registration for UEA and Cardiff University's 'Spirited Discussions: Exploring 30 Years of Studio Ghibli' conference on 18 April 2015 is now open. We have a great, international line-up of speakers coming from around the world to discuss Japan's foremost animation studio, including a keynote presentation by Professor Susan J. Napier, a leading gobal authority on anime studies. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T17:24:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Melanie Williams (AMA)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;9724576e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;7c43b1eb.1503">   <title>Reply: Sight and Sound's 25 important women who write on film </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;7c43b1eb.1503</link>   <description> Pam Cook writes:<br><br>&gt; One way to look at lists is as a marketing tool.<br>They are partial and subjective, and people contest them, creating a<br>'buzz' (or mini-buzz like the one that appears here). Sight and Sound is<br>good at using lists in this way - its regular polls work to reinforce<br>its status as a serious international film magazine. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T08:42:21-07:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Leo Enticknap</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;7c43b1eb.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;2cc587b6.1503">   <title>Reminder: Call for Chapters: Community Filmmaking: Diversity, Innovation, Policy and Practice </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;2cc587b6.1503</link>   <description> Call for Chapters: Community Filmmaking: Diversity, Innovation, Policy and Practice<br><br>Editors:<br>Sarita Malik (Sociology/Communications, Brunel University London) Caroline Chapain (Birmingham Business School, University of Birmingham) Roberta Comunian (Creative Industries, Kings College London)<br><br>The community arts movement of the 1960s and 1970s was based on the assumption that community-led activity was representative of the people, and thus merited public investment. Since then, community filmmaking has been a good example of community-led arts activity, often with a civic agenda, that lacks public investment. Research around the role of cinema and society has tended to focus on the mainstream film value chain, with [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T15:16:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sarita Malik</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;2cc587b6.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;5634713.1503">   <title>call for chapters on Aki Kaurism\ufffd\ufffdki</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;5634713.1503</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>Call for chapters: The Films of Aki Kaurism\ufffd\ufffdki<br><br>Despite creating an extensive and innovative body of work over the last 30 years, Aki Kaurism\ufffd\ufffdki remains relatively neglected in Anglophone scholarship. This collection of original essays and selected translations aims to redress such neglect by offering a range of critical inquiries into Kaurism\ufffd\ufffdki\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds politically and aesthetically compelling cinema. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T15:22:33+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Thomas Austin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;5634713.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;b7bfab24.1503">   <title>Re: Reply: Sight and Sound's 25 important women who write on film </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;b7bfab24.1503</link>   <description> One way to look at lists is as a marketing tool. They are partial and subjective, and people contest them, creating a \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdbuzz\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (or mini-buzz like the one that appears here). Sight and Sound is good at using lists in this way - its regular polls work to reinforce its status as a serious international film magazine. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T13:37:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Pam Cook</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;b7bfab24.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;82c74097.1503">   <title>Re: Reply: Sight and Sound's 25 important women who write on film </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;82c74097.1503</link>   <description> Dear all, I am very interested in this topic. I work on Italian women filmmakers. Actually I am working at a collection of biographies and filmographies of Italian fwomen filmmakers and Italian women scriptwriters.<br>Please let me know if you are interested in contributing with a biographical entry to my collection.<br>Thank you, Maristella Cantini http://www.palgrave.com/page/detail/italian-women-filmmakers-and-the-gendered-screen-maristella-cantini/?K=9781137336507 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T13:01:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stella Cantini</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;82c74097.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;cf298440.1503">   <title>Re: Reply: Sight and Sound's 25 important women who write on film </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;cf298440.1503</link>   <description> Just to stem the email tide - I do not hold the (patently absurd) view that we can/should only speak from and for our own identity positions. I was merely commenting on the way this particular argument was going, and on the seeming failure to notice any irony in the act of shouting ever louder about the need to make a space for women's voices .... [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-10T12:26:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Laura Marcus</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;cf298440.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;b2a076f2.1503">   <title>Re: Reply: Sight and Sound's 25 important women who write on film </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BAFTSS;b2a076f2.1503</link>   <description> Absolutely, Elisabetta!
